summary: Olives, scientifically known as *Olea europaea*, are small trees or shrubs originally from the Mediterranean region. They're now grown in many parts of the world. The fruit, also called olives, is used to make olive oil and is a key ingredient in Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cooking. There are thousands of different types (cultivars) of olive trees, grown for their oil or their fruit, which we eat. Most olives (80%) are made into oil, while the rest are used as food.
title: Olive
